prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
The witness Armstrong is the owner of the restaurant where the murder took place. He is testifying about where the old man Victor, who was another witness, and the victim were sitting.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: But naturally, I did not touch anything else!
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
To find a contradiction, let's examine Armstrong's testimonies and match them against the evidences.

In testimony 3, Armstrong states: "After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way."

Now, let's look at the evidences. Evidence 12 is a crime photo that shows the dining tables and the folding screen. The caption mentions a knocked over coffee cup, a stained table cloth, and, crucially, it indicates that no one was seated across from the victim. This suggests no one was actually at the table nearest the victim since it was empty. 

Testimony 3 implies Armstrong moved the mirror after the incident, potentially obstructing important details in the scene captured in Evidence 12. The contradiction is in the details regarding the moving of objects post-incident.

Therefore, Armstrong’s testimony about moving the mirror contradicts the crime photo evidence that captures the scene after the murder. Armstrong’s action could suggest tampering or an alteration to the scene, which should have remained untouched until after the investigation.

{"evidence": 12, "testimony": 3}

Testimony 0
Testimony: La victim, Monsieur Elg, 'e came to my restaurant alone.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im, just after 2 PM.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: Z'ere were no other customers.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: When 'e got word 'e won la lottery, Mon. Elg became very excited.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was approximately 5 minutes later z'at la poisoning incident occurred.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 6
Testimony: Non, z'ere was no time for a phony to do la acting.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
To identify a contradiction between the testimonies given by Jean Armstrong and the provided evidences, let's analyze Jean Armstrong's testimonies:

1. Armstrong claims that Monsieur Elg, the victim, came to his restaurant alone (Testimony 0).
2. Armstrong states that the old man arrived not long after him, around just after 2 PM (Testimony 2).
3. Armstrong also claims there were no other customers at the restaurant when the incident happened (Testimony 3).

Now, let's consider Victor Kudo's note:

- Evidence 9 (Victor's Note): "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo."

Victor Kudo was present at the time of the incident as per his note and was indeed a customer during the event. This contradicts Armstrong's testimony 3, where he claimed there were no other customers apart from the victim and the old man.

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 9 (Victor's Note) and Testimony 3 by Jean Armstrong.

{"evidence": 9, "testimony": 3}

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I don't know nothin' about no murder.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 1
Testimony: I was tied up with business in December last year. Spent all'a my time in my office.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 2
Testimony: The day youse talkin' about, I was in de office, too. I never saw that kid before.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 3
Testimony: I got whales lined up to borrow cash from Tender Lender every single day.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 4
Testimony: Youse wanna check my alibi, just ask Violetta.
Person: Tigre

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Let's examine Furio Tigre's testimony and see if there are any direct contradictions with the listed evidence. The important aspects of Tigre's testimony are:

- He claims he doesn't know anything about the murder.
- He states he was occupied with business in December and spent all his time in his office.
- He claims he was in the office on the day of the incident and never saw the victim.
- He suggests asking Violetta to check his alibi.

Tigre Testimony 3 states: "I got whales lined up to borrow cash from Tender Lender every single day."

To find a contradiction, we should explore if there is any evidence indicating that Tigre was involved or had contact with Glen. 

Consider Evidence 20, Glen's Calendar, which says: "On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, 'Meet with The Tiger'."

The note on Glen's Calendar indicates that Glen had a meeting scheduled with "The Tiger" (Furio Tigre) on the day of the incident, contradicting Tigre's testimony that he never saw Glen. Furthermore, it suggests Tigre was supposed to meet Glen, contradicting the claim that he was busy with other clients all day. 

Therefore, Evidence 20 provides a direct contradiction to Tigre Testimony 3.

{"evidence": 20, "testimony": 3}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
To identify the contradiction between Tigre's testimony and the evidence:

- Testimony 3 states that Tigre set up a meeting with Glen Elg but the victim never showed up at Tender Lender.
- However, Evidence 20, Glen's Calendar, notes a scheduled meeting with "The Tiger" on December 3rd, the same day Glen was poisoned, which suggests he indeed planned to meet Tigre but never made it because he ended up at Tres Bien. 

This contradicts Tigre's testimony that the meeting didn't happen due to Glen not showing up.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Testimony 3 from Tigre mentions that he left the restaurant when he saw the scene because he figured it would get "hot." However, Evidence 11, the Tres Bien Floor Plans, indicates that the view from the entrance is obstructed, suggesting that Tigre could not have seen the crime scene directly from the entrance. This contradiction indicates that Tigre might not be truthful about when he decided to leave.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
The testimony by Tigre, "I'm about to flatten the guy, when he starts screamin'," (Testimony 3) implies that Glen Elg won the lottery and therefore had money to pay. However, Evidence 14, Victim's Lottery Ticket, indicates that Glen actually had a winning ticket for half a million dollars, which counters the idea that he claimed he couldn't pay up. This discrepancy suggests that Tigre's aggression was unnecessary since Glen had funds.
